title: Rendering rule examples
content:
The following examples demonstrate how to formulate rules for each of the rendering rule templates:

Disable fields

The only parameter in this rule template is fields. Click the link and select the required fields. When the rule runs, the selected fields become disabled in the user interface. Use this rule if you want to make fields read-only for UI users but not limit backend or API actions. 

Display list by alphabetical order

The only parameter in this rule template is of the Enum or Enum Set type. Select the Enum/Enum Set field from the drop-down list. When the rule runs, the values in the selected field will be displayed in alphabetical order in the form.

Expand section by default

  1. For the form parameter, select the required form from the drop-down list.
  2. For the sections parameter, select the required section from the drop-down list. The list displays the sections on the form selected.
  3. When the rule runs, it expands the selected section of the selected form by default.
This rule template doesn't take effect for the Resolution section of Service Request and Incident record types.

Hide actions

The only parameter in this rule template is actions. From the drop-down list, select the actions you want to hide. When the rule runs, the selected actions disappear from the form.

The drop-down list contains all custom actions and a number of out-of-the-box actions. Some out-of-the-box actions are considered essential and can't be hidden, for example, the Refresh action is not on the list.

This rule relies on simulation results to take effect, and you may see the action in the UI for several seconds. 

Hide fields

The only parameter in this rule template is fields. Click the link and select the required fields. When the rule runs, the selected fields are hidden on the user interface.

Hide sections

  1. For the form parameter, select the required form from the drop-down list.
  2. For the sections parameter, select the required sections from the drop-down list. The list displays the sections on the form selected. For full forms, you can also select to hide the Attachments part of the form.
  3. When the rule runs, the selected sections are hidden on the selected form.

Hide tabs

The only parameter in this rule template is tabs. Select the required tabs from the drop-down list. You can hide the Discussion and History tabs. When the rule runs, the selected tabs are hidden on the record page.

Example: In Problem Management, you can define the rule Hide Discussions to hide the Discussions tab on the record page for Problem records.

Restrict/allow editing of fields

  • The Restrict/allow editing of fields business rule functions both as a rendering rule and as a validation rule (in the user interface, it appears under Rendering rules). It restricts or allows editing of selected fields for all actions, UI-based, backend process-based, or API-based. 
  • If you want to use this rule to restrict editing the specific fields, be sure not to use any other rules to set the value of these fields.
  • If you want to use this rule to restrict editing the specific fields by agents or end users on the UI, use the disable rule instead.

  1. For the Restrict/allow parameter, select the required action - Restrict or Allow.

  2. For the all fields/specific fields parameter, specify the fields to which the action applies. Click All fields to restrict or allow editing of all fields for this record type. Click Specific fields to limit the restriction or permission to the selected fields. Select the required field from the drop-down list. Click Add item to add another row to select an additional field. The default is All fields.

  3. When the rule runs, it restricts or allows editing of the selected fields. Restricted fields are unavailable for editing in the user interface. However, restricted field values can still be updated by workflow business rules.

    One use case for this business rule could be to disable all the fields of a record when it reaches the end of its workflow.

Example: There is a system rule for Requests that disables all fields on the request tracking page in the Service Portal.

  • All of the rules can be formulated with the "If...Then" option, which includes an expression parameter for the condition. Make sure to enter an Expression Language phrase that returns a boolean value.
  • Rendering rules are only available for the Rendering Forms process event.

Restrict/allow attachments

  • The Restrict/allow attachments rule enables administrators to restrict or allow uploading or deleting of attachments in specific fields, such as Attachments or rich text fields (comments, descriptions, etc.), based on user-defined conditions. 
  • In the user interface, it appears under Rendering rules in both Studio and User Options rules.
  • This rule is applicable across Service Portal, Agent interface, and Mobile app UI. 
  • This rule does not impact the ability to view or download attachments.

To configure this rule:

  1. For the Restrict/allow parameter, select the required action - Restrict or Allow​​​​​​.
  2. Select Action - Upload, Delete, or All.
  3. For the All fields/Specific fields parameter, specify the rich text fields to which the action applies. Click All fields to enable or disable attachments for every field that supports attachments. Click Specific fields to apply the restriction or permission only to a selected list of fields. Select the required fields from the drop-down list. Click Add item to add another row to select an additional field. The default is All fields.
  4. When the rule runs, it restricts or allows attachments of the selected fields. Restricted actions are unavailable in the user interface. The Add attachment and Delete buttons or the x icon on the UI are either hidden or disabled. 
When the Restrict/allow attachments rule is active, the following messages appear when you attempt to upload or delete an attachment for a field that has the restriction applied:
Attachments are disabled due to business rules. or Deletion is disabled on already saved attachments.
